result.execSummary:
The defendant Demetrius Terrance Wilkerson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court ordered the defendant to pay all costs and surcharges including the DNA surcharge, to be collected by the DOC at the maximum allowable amount out of all prison wages and any other funds by July 29, 2025.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Restitution set at zero.
Concurrent to any other case and concurrent to revocation, with credit for 142 DAYS time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demetrius Terrance Wilkerson

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Incarceration Credit received and filed.  bm

Defendant Demetrius Terrance Wilkerson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Demetrius Terrance Wilkerson in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

  Sentencing proceeded. Statements made as to sentencing.  State compliant with victim notification.  State's offer placed on the record.  

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to any other case and CONCURRENT to revocation, with credit for 142 DAYS time served

The Court ordered the defendant to pay all costs and surcharges including the DNA surcharge, to be collected by the DOC at the maximum allowable amount out of all prison wages and any other funds by July 29, 2025.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Restitution set at zero.
Defendant NOT required to register as a sex offender.

Appellate rights given to defendant
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea received and filed.  bm
Jury Instructions received and filed.  bm
State's Offer Letter received and filed. bm
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  bm
Victim Impact Statement.  Received and Filed.  nk

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court, defendant Demetrius Terrance Wilkerson not in court, in custody.  Defendant's Appearance Waived.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nk
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference.  Defense received Offer and Discovery from State.  Defense requested Plea/Sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court, defendant Demetrius Terrance Wilkerson not in court, in custody. Emily Zimmel for Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nk
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference.  Defense has Discovery and requesting time for review. 
  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel. Received and Filed. nk

Court ordered no contact with C.D.G
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Demetrius Terrance Wilkerson in court with attorney Matt W Kline.  Defendant Demetrius Terrance Wilkerson in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Demetrius Terrance Wilkerson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
